==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かつ|ぜつ}}

===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|*/kwatu zetu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kwat͡su zet͡su/}} → {{IPAchar|/kat͡su zet͡su/}}

Possibly from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=かつぜつ}} compound {{m|zh|滑舌|tr=hwɛt + zyet|lit=slippery, smooth + tongue}}.

Alternatively, may have been coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived elements, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=滑舌|滑|tr1=katsu|t1=smooth|舌|tr2=zetsu|t2=tongue}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|かつぜつ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|活舌}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|かつぜつ|hhira=くわつぜつ}}

# [[enunciation]]
#: {{ja-usex|主人公の俳優は'''滑舌'''が悪くて、台詞があまり聞き取れなかったね。|^しゅじんこう の はいゆう は '''かつぜつ''' が わるくて、 せりふ が あまり ききとれなかった ね。|The actor playing the lead character had bad '''enunciation''', and I couldn't quite hear his lines.}}

====Usage notes====
Generally used to describe the speech of a [[stage]] [[actor]] or television [[presenter]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
